modules.description: This module implements TLS client functionality for secure network communication. It provides operations to create and manage TLS connections, including upgrading existing connections, shutting them down, and checking their status. The module works with TLS sockets and integrates with Lwt for asynchronous I/O operations.

This module implements SSL/TLS server functionality for handling secure network connections. It provides functions to create connection handlers that process incoming SSL sockets with customizable protocols and request handling logic, supporting operations like ALPN protocol negotiation during handshake. The module works directly with SSL sockets, Unix addresses, and file descriptors, enabling use cases such as building HTTPS servers or secure RPC endpoints.

This module implements TLS server functionality for handling secure network connections. It provides functions to create connection handlers that process incoming TLS-encrypted requests, supporting protocol upgrades and ALPN negotiation. The module works with TLS sockets, Unix addresses, and integrates with Lwt for asynchronous I/O operations.

This module implements SSL/TLS client functionality for secure network communication. It provides operations to create and manage SSL sockets, upgrade existing connections, and handle connection lifecycle events. Key functions include creating a client with a specified protocol, upgrading a plain socket to SSL, and shutting down or checking the state of a connection. It works directly with Lwt_ssl.socket and integrates with file descriptors for low-level I/O operations. Common use cases include implementing HTTPS clients and secure WebSocket connections.

This module manages client-side network communication over Unix file descriptors, supporting both plaintext and encrypted protocols through direct socket operations and integration with Lwt for asynchronous I/O. It provides functions to establish, upgrade, and terminate connections, enabling use cases such as HTTP and HTTPS clients, secure messaging, and networked services. The TLS and SSL submodules extend this functionality by implementing secure communication layers, allowing clients to create and manage encrypted sockets, upgrade existing connections, and inspect connection states using protocol-specific APIs. Together, the module and its submodules support building robust, secure, and asynchronous network clients with fine-grained control over I/O and connection lifecycles.

This module manages network connections with Lwt-based asynchronous I/O, supporting both plaintext and encrypted communication over TCP. It works directly with Unix sockets and file descriptors, integrating with Gluten to handle client requests through customizable protocols and secure channels. The SSL submodule enables secure servers with ALPN negotiation and protocol handling over SSL sockets, while the TLS submodule provides similar functionality using TLS encryption. Together, they allow building flexible servers such as HTTPS or secure RPC services with asynchronous request processing.

This module provides asynchronous network communication over Unix file descriptors, supporting both plaintext and encrypted protocols like HTTP, HTTPS, and secure RPC. It includes core operations for establishing, upgrading, and managing connections with Lwt, alongside SSL and TLS submodules for secure communication with ALPN negotiation and protocol-specific handling. You can build clients and servers that handle encrypted traffic, inspect connection states, and manage I/O with fine-grained control. Examples include HTTPS clients, secure messaging services, and asynchronous networked applications with customizable protocols.
